name: ue4-intellisense-fixes
description: Automatically fixes Unreal Engine Intellisense configuration on startup.

UEIntellisenseFixes.enableOptionalFixes.markdownDescription: `(Optimization)` Unreal Source uses Tag Parser Intellisense instead of the Default Intellisense (modifies UnrealPath/.vscode/settings.json)

UEIntellisenseFixes.compiler.path.markdownDescription: The compiler path that will be set in compile commands and compilerPath setting. `Mac` users may have to set this to `/usr/bin/clang++` for Intellisense to work. `Restart after changing this.`

UEIntellisenseFixes.compiler.pathIsProje.markdownDescription: True: Compiler path is project specific and set in project's workspace config. False: Compiler path is set in the User(global) config.

UEIntellisenseFixes.compiler.intellisens.markdownDescription: `Most users won't need to set this:` Mac M1 users will automatically be set to clang-x64 if blank. If creating a Mac M1 Native/arm64 project you'll need to set this to clang-arm64. `Restart VSCode after setting this. Reset project if you ever delete this.`

UEIntellisenseFixes.fixes.warnIfMissingS.markdownDescription: `Shouldn't have to manually set` True: No longer warns to reset project if source files are not found compile commands. `You'll have to remember to reset project when adding files.`

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
